concise_definition: v. 建议, 劝告, 提供咨询

definitions.explanation_en: To offer suggestions or recommendations based on knowledge, experience, or expertise, with the intention of helping someone make a better decision.
definitions.explanation_cn: 基于知识、经验或专业能力，提供意见或建议，旨在帮助他人做出更明智的决定。
definitions.example_en: She was advising her client on the best investment strategy.
definitions.example_cn: 她正在为客户建议最佳的投资策略。

definitions.explanation_en: To act in the role of a consultant or counselor, providing guidance on legal, financial, medical, or personal matters.
definitions.explanation_cn: 担任顾问或咨询者角色，就法律、财务、医疗或个人事务提供指导。
definitions.example_en: He spent years advising governments on environmental policy.
definitions.example_cn: 他多年来一直就环境政策为政府提供咨询。

definitions.explanation_en: To caution or warn someone about potential risks or consequences, often to prevent harm or error.
definitions.explanation_cn: 提醒或警告某人潜在的风险或后果，通常是为了防止伤害或错误。
definitions.example_en: The doctor advised him against smoking due to his heart condition.
definitions.example_cn: 医生因他的心脏状况劝他戒烟。

comparison.analysis: “Suggesting” (提议) 语气较轻，通常仅提出一个可能性或选项，不带有强烈的责任或专业权威性。而 “advising” 暗示了更正式、更负责任的指导，通常基于专业知识或经验，对方更可能被期望遵从。
“Counseling” (咨询) 通常指长期、系统性的心理或情感支持，尤其在心理学或社会工作语境中。而 “advising” 更侧重于提供具体、实用的建议，时间跨度较短，目的更直接。两者可重叠，但 “counseling” 更强调情感支持，而 “advising” 更强调理性判断。
“Recommending” (推荐) 常用于推荐产品、服务或选择，语气偏向偏好或偏好性判断，不一定包含深入分析。而 “advising” 更强调全面评估、权衡利弊后的专业判断，通常包含更充分的理由和背景支持。
